body_html:
Correction: ci_build.sh calls out to https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tools/ci_build/builds/configured, which in turn answers the default answer to all questions, so it uses python2...

You could manually run ./configure and point to python3. Then run
bazel test //tensorflow/contrib/opt:multitask_optimizer_wrapper_test
body_text:
Correction: ci_build.sh calls out to https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tools/ci_build/builds/configured, which in turn answers the default answer to all questions, so it uses python2...
You could manually run ./configure and point to python3. Then run
bazel test //tensorflow/contrib/opt:multitask_optimizer_wrapper_test
body:
Correction: ci_build.sh calls out to https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tools/ci_build/builds/configured, which in turn answers the default answer to all questions, so it uses python2...

You could manually run `./configure` and point to python3. Then run
`bazel test //tensorflow/contrib/opt:multitask_optimizer_wrapper_test`
